properties.name: The Old Finsbury Town Hall
properties.description: Opened by Lord Rosebery, an ornate building with elegant decor influenced by the Art Nouveau movement. Several notable rooms including the Great Hall with unique stained glass, antique mirrors and Clerkenwell Angel statuettes.

properties.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office
properties.description: Grade I listed Victorian government office buildings. Route includes the magnificent and richly decorated Durbar Court, India Office Council Chamber, Locarno Suite and Foreign Office Grand Staircase.

properties.name: The Swedenborg Society
properties.description: Grade II listed Georgian domestic building c1760, formerly part of Bedford Estate. Interior refurbished 1924-5 to form lecture hall (restored 2014), library, bookshop and offices. Oak woodwork and green Doulton tiles line the staircase.

properties.name: Guildhall Art Gallery
properties.description: Houses the City of London's art collection, built over remains of London's 2C Roman amphitheatre. Façade uses Portland stone and Collyweston stone slates. Interior uses finishes of marble, American elm, damask and painted wall coverings.

properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence
properties.description: Known as the 'Independent North Mansion' and christened by Sydney Herbert as 'Belgrave Villa' and then simply 'The Villa' by his successor the 6th Duke of Richmond. Owned by Argentina since 1936 and with sumptuous interiors still intact.

properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence
properties.description: Known as the 'Independent North Mansion' and christened by Sydney Herbert as 'Belgrave Villa' and then simply 'The Villa' by his successor the 6th Duke of Richmond. Owned by Argentina since 1936 and with sumptuous interiors still intact.

properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence
properties.description: Known as the 'Independent North Mansion' and christened by Sydney Herbert as 'Belgrave Villa' and then simply 'The Villa' by his successor the 6th Duke of Richmond. Owned by Argentina since 1936 and with sumptuous interiors still intact.

properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence
properties.description: Known as the 'Independent North Mansion' and christened by Sydney Herbert as 'Belgrave Villa' and then simply 'The Villa' by his successor the 6th Duke of Richmond. Owned by Argentina since 1936 and with sumptuous interiors still intact.

properties.name: Argentine Ambassador's Residence
properties.description: Known as the 'Independent North Mansion' and christened by Sydney Herbert as 'Belgrave Villa' and then simply 'The Villa' by his successor the 6th Duke of Richmond. Owned by Argentina since 1936 and with sumptuous interiors still intact.

properties.name: The Ismaili Centre
properties.description: Part of an international family of Ismaili Centres, a religious, cultural and social space for the Shia Ismaili Muslim community. The serenity of the entrance fountain to the roof garden reflects Muslim traditions in architecture and design

properties.name: The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer
properties.description: A unique II* listed Italianate church by John Dando Sedding with attached Campanile and Institute Building. Of particular significance in the church is the imposing baldacchino over the High Altar, which dominates the east end.

properties.name: The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer
properties.description: A unique II* listed Italianate church by John Dando Sedding with attached Campanile and Institute Building. Of particular significance in the church is the imposing baldacchino over the High Altar, which dominates the east end.

properties.name: St Dunstan and All Saints Church
properties.description: Grade I listed early medieval parish church (from 952 before Tower of London) in spacious churchyard. Fine interior: Anglo-Saxon Rood, Norman font, 'squint', fine memorials incl founders of Trinity House, 1950s glass. Bells of Stepney.

properties.name: The City Centre
properties.description: An overview of the latest developments and architecture in the City of London via the interactive 1:500 scale Pipers model that shows the future skyline with all of the proposed new towers.

properties.name: Chiswick House
properties.description: One of the earliest and finest examples of Neo-Palladian design in the UK, Chiswick House is an 18C villa in west London. The 65 acres of Grade I listed gardens are the birthplace of the English Landscape Movement.

properties.name: Whitehall Historic House
properties.description: Originally a farmer's house dating to 1500, with jettied upper storey. Later additions reflect the changing lifestyles of the owners, including the Killicks for over two centuries. Now houses scale model of Henry VIII's Nonsuch Palace.

properties.name: St George's German Lutheran Church
properties.description: The oldest surviving German church in England from 1763 with unaltered Georgian interior including box pews, German memorials and wheezy German Walcker organ from 1870.

properties.name: Honeywood Museum
properties.description: Chalk and flint house dating to 17C with additions including extensions of 1896 and 1903 when owned by John Pattinson Kirk. Rich in period detail and the interior restored and stairs opened up with funding from the Heritage Lottery Fund.

properties.name: City Information Centre
properties.description: London's main tourist information centre is clad in a specially manufactured system of 220 pre-finished stainless steel panels. This subtly reflective surface provides a striking counterpoint to St Paul's. RIBA Award Winner 2009.

properties.name: Silchester Estate
properties.description: New development of 112 mixed tenure homes, community and retail facilities delivered by Peabody and RBKC. Designed around a communal garden and integrating an existing 20-storey tower within a new urban block. Sculpture by Nathan Coley.

properties.name: Silchester Estate
properties.description: New development of 112 mixed tenure homes, community and retail facilities delivered by Peabody and RBKC. Designed around a communal garden and integrating an existing 20-storey tower within a new urban block. Sculpture by Nathan Coley.

properties.name: Silchester Estate
properties.description: New development of 112 mixed tenure homes, community and retail facilities delivered by Peabody and RBKC. Designed around a communal garden and integrating an existing 20-storey tower within a new urban block. Sculpture by Nathan Coley.

properties.name: German Historical Institute
properties.description: This Grade II* listed building includes an Adam-style ceiling on the 1st floor and a beautiful staircase with wrought-iron balustrade. Once home to the Pharmaceutical Society of Great Britain, it now houses an historical research institute.

properties.name: The Library at Willesden Green
properties.description: A modern 4-storey building incorporating the much-loved Victorian library. The galleries and feature walls display exhibitions and contemporary art and a dramatic central atrium provides natural ventilation and daylight throughout.

properties.name: Anise Gallery / AVR London
properties.description: An 1870s Zion Chapel on the Malham Road industrial Estate recently renovated into a family home. Guided tours of the Old Chapel will be available throughout the day.

properties.name: Maggie's Barts
properties.description: Maggie's Barts opened in December 2017. Maggie's Centres are unique, welcoming and uplifting places with qualified staff on hand to provide free practical, emotional and social support for people with cancer, their families and friends.

properties.name: SPPARC
properties.description: This award-winning practice has an exciting UK & International portfolio & invites you to take part in live debates, explore its workshops, listen to talks & become part of the design process.

properties.name: Sun Rain Rooms
properties.description: Set in a Grade II listed Georgian townhouse, Tonkin Liu's studio has been extended. Designed and built by the practice, an innovative timber roof and reflecting pool gathers the bouncing rain, to make it a good place to be on a bad day.

properties.name: Sun Rain Rooms
properties.description: Set in a Grade II listed Georgian townhouse, Tonkin Liu's studio has been extended. Designed and built by the practice, an innovative timber roof and reflecting pool gathers the bouncing rain, to make it a good place to be on a bad day.

properties.name: Sun Rain Rooms
properties.description: Set in a Grade II listed Georgian townhouse, Tonkin Liu's studio has been extended. Designed and built by the practice, an innovative timber roof and reflecting pool gathers the bouncing rain, to make it a good place to be on a bad day.

properties.name: Foundry Co-Working Hub
properties.description: Cullinan Studio converted this Victorian warehouse into their low-energy office in 2012, retaining 80% of the existing building fabric. The Foundry co-working hub is now home to several organisations working in the built environment.

properties.name: Foundry Co-Working Hub
properties.description: Cullinan Studio converted this Victorian warehouse into their low-energy office in 2012, retaining 80% of the existing building fabric. The Foundry co-working hub is now home to several organisations working in the built environment.

properties.name: Foundry Co-Working Hub
properties.description: Cullinan Studio converted this Victorian warehouse into their low-energy office in 2012, retaining 80% of the existing building fabric. The Foundry co-working hub is now home to several organisations working in the built environment.

properties.name: Estorick Collection of Modern Italian Art
properties.description: The Estorick Collection is housed in a beautiful Georgian building previously known as Northampton Lodge. Today, the museum comprises six galleries over three floors, as well as a library, offices, a café and bookshop.

properties.name: King's Cross Masterplan
properties.description: The King’s Cross Masterplan established a framework for the incremental redevelopment of this industrial heritage site through a mix of uses and a network of public spaces structuring new urban blocks and knitting the site into its context.

properties.name: Olympic Legacy Masterplan
properties.description: London’s 2012 Games provided a catalyst for regeneration in the Lower Lea Valley. Guided by the Legacy Masterplan, thousands of new homes and jobs are now being created, stitching together existing communities across the former floodplain.

properties.name: 100 Liverpool Street
properties.description: Undergoing major redevelopment, 100 Liverpool Street  provides a positive working environment of 433,000 sq ft of bright and airy office space, 90,000 sq ft of of new shops and restaurants across three levels,.

properties.name: 100 Liverpool Street
properties.description: Undergoing major redevelopment, 100 Liverpool Street  provides a positive working environment of 433,000 sq ft of bright and airy office space, 90,000 sq ft of of new shops and restaurants across three levels,.

properties.name: 100 Liverpool Street
properties.description: Undergoing major redevelopment, 100 Liverpool Street  provides a positive working environment of 433,000 sq ft of bright and airy office space, 90,000 sq ft of of new shops and restaurants across three levels,.

properties.name: PEER
properties.description: PEER is a gallery with a 10-metre wide glass façade, bringing art straight onto the street. With its community garden, and Chris Ofili's 'Black Hands' outdoor clock, PEER is also a welcoming and open public space.

properties.name: All Hallows Twickenham
properties.description: All Hallows is a Grade I Listed building with an interesting history. Built by Sir Christopher Wren in Lombard Street, London. The tower, bells, cloister and many furnishings were moved to Twickenham in 1939 as the building had subsidence.

properties.name: Museum of Neoliberalism
properties.description: The museum is situated in a shopfront in Leegate Shopping Centre, which has been described by the Evening Standard as "the worst shopping precinct in the country."

properties.name: West Hendon Masterplan
properties.description: The West Hendon masterplan has been developed in order to regenerate a 1960s housing estate adjacent to the Welsh Harp reservoir. It incorporates affordable housing, new public parks, primary school, community centre and commercial space.

properties.name: Kingston School of Art
properties.description: Haworth Tompkins have delivered a transformative overhaul of Kingston University’s Knights Park Campus to provide over 10,000 sqm of refurbished creative space for Kingston School of Art.

properties.name: Kingston School of Art
properties.description: Haworth Tompkins have delivered a transformative overhaul of Kingston University’s Knights Park Campus to provide over 10,000 sqm of refurbished creative space for Kingston School of Art.

properties.name: Kingston School of Art
properties.description: Haworth Tompkins have delivered a transformative overhaul of Kingston University’s Knights Park Campus to provide over 10,000 sqm of refurbished creative space for Kingston School of Art.

properties.name: Alderman Jones House
properties.description: Becontree Estate two storey cottage house with garden located on a banjo.

properties.name: Reliance Arcade
properties.description: Reliance Arcade is a Grade II Listed covered market in Brixton, London.  The Arcade was constructed in the 1920s and is home to 40 small retail units catering largely to local African-Caribbean communities.

properties.name: Soho tour by SODA Studio
properties.description: SODA Studio will lead two tours of Soho by day and by night to explore both historic and contemporary buildings that they know and love, which help create the modern 'village' we know today.

properties.name: Virtual TOUR – The Saints and the City of London
properties.description: Virtual tour will use a variety of saints to access many of the religious sites of City of London

properties.name: Slavery and the City
properties.description: We will explore sites and institutions with direct links to the history of slavery and hear why the apologies were made last year, whilst wandering within the story packed streets and alleyways of the Square Mile.

properties.name: Flow Gallery
properties.description: The interior of the building was redesigned in 2014 by John Pardey  to combine a craft gallery with a live work space for the gallery owner. Inspired by Kettle's Yard Flow space exhibits ceramics, glass, wood, textiles and jewellery.

properties.name: National Youth Theatre
properties.description: Completed in Summer 2021, the National Youth Theatre has been redeveloped to double its capacity for studio space and was designed with young people, for young people. Recipient of the Mayor of London's Good Growth Fund.

properties.name: National Youth Theatre
properties.description: Completed in Summer 2021, the National Youth Theatre has been redeveloped to double its capacity for studio space and was designed with young people, for young people. Recipient of the Mayor of London's Good Growth Fund.

properties.name: National Youth Theatre
properties.description: Completed in Summer 2021, the National Youth Theatre has been redeveloped to double its capacity for studio space and was designed with young people, for young people. Recipient of the Mayor of London's Good Growth Fund.

properties.name: Hyde Park Chapel
properties.description: The four-story Church façade and prominent seven-story tower is covered in Portland stone and highlighted by a golden steeple. The interior features the Christus statue and a large mural of the resurrected Jesus Christ.

properties.name: St Bride's Church, Fleet Street
properties.description: Wren designed building of 1675, interior lost in blitz of 1940, reopened 1957 with 'Wren inspired' interior

properties.name: St Bride's Church, Fleet Street
properties.description: Wren designed building of 1675, interior lost in blitz of 1940, reopened 1957 with 'Wren inspired' interior

properties.name: Ripple Greenway and the Lost Words Art Trail
properties.description:
Ripple Greenway is a beautiful 14-acre linear park and art trail.  Home to Katy Hallett’s steel sculptures, inspired by Robert Macfarlane’s and Jackie Morris’ The Lost Words.
Wooden play and exercise equipment, picnic tables and benches.

properties.name: Stuart Shave Modern Art Gallery
properties.description: Modern art gallery refurbished and restored in 2020 by architect Giles Reid. The gallery comprises two floors, plus a staff office used for private viewing. Rooms are unified by minimal detailing, traditional joinery and parquet.

properties.name: Expressway
properties.description: Expressway is already the chosen home for nearly 200 thriving businesses that support an around 1,100 jobs. Covering over 120,000 sqft of cost-effective office, light industrial & storage space all located under the Silvertown Way flyover.

properties.name: Enfield To Fork - Edmonton Green Shopping Centre
properties.description: The Museum of Enfield is this year bringing its temporary exhibition to you! “From Enfield to Fork” explores the borough’s history and relationship with food, from Roman Enfield to Market Gardening.

properties.name: The Former Peek Frean’s Biscuit Factory, Bermondsey
properties.description: Part of the former Peek Frean’s Biscuit Factory, the birthplace of Twiglets and the Garibaldi, this 1970s warehouse is now at the heart of a new community for Bermondsey.

properties.name: Nunnery Gallery
properties.description: In 1868 the Dominican sisters established a convent in the heart of the East End. Today, the Nunnery Gallery maintains some of its original neo-gothic features, and original hardwood floor and hosts a programme of site-responsive art.

properties.name: 38 Grosvenor Square
properties.description: A beautiful Mayfair town house c 1727 original to the Square. Transformed 1776 by John Johnson for Duke of Dorset; magnificent staircase, lavish ‘Adamesque’ entertaining suite. Mid-C19 Italianate front by Thomas Cundy.

properties.name: 38 Grosvenor Square
properties.description: A beautiful Mayfair town house c 1727 original to the Square. Transformed 1776 by John Johnson for Duke of Dorset; magnificent staircase, lavish ‘Adamesque’ entertaining suite. Mid-C19 Italianate front by Thomas Cundy.

properties.name: 38 Grosvenor Square
properties.description: A beautiful Mayfair town house c 1727 original to the Square. Transformed 1776 by John Johnson for Duke of Dorset; magnificent staircase, lavish ‘Adamesque’ entertaining suite. Mid-C19 Italianate front by Thomas Cundy.

properties.name: Dreamings collage art exhibition
properties.description: A collage art exhibition. Every day except Monday and Tuesday. A talk "Why Collage?" on Sunday evening at 7, followed by a Q&A and an art raffle for charity

properties.name: Studio Flox
properties.description: Studio Flox at Watermans Art Centre is a combined arts centre. It is located in Brentford, England alongside the banks of the River Thames overlooking Kew Gardens in West London, England

properties.name: Tooley Street Beacon
properties.description: The Tooley Street Beacon, complete with large floor map of the local area, is a new and striking landmark at the Tooley Street Triangle, creating a new public square (or triangle) outside the main entrance to London Bridge station.

properties.name: Tooley Street Beacon
properties.description: The Tooley Street Beacon, complete with large floor map of the local area, is a new and striking landmark at the Tooley Street Triangle, creating a new public square (or triangle) outside the main entrance to London Bridge station.

properties.name: Tooley Street Beacon
properties.description: The Tooley Street Beacon, complete with large floor map of the local area, is a new and striking landmark at the Tooley Street Triangle, creating a new public square (or triangle) outside the main entrance to London Bridge station.

properties.name: Self-guided Old Malden Walk
properties.description: The walk is around Old Malden and covers residential developments within the district. Different styles of suburban architecture includes a selection of modernist housing. There are also historic buildings and other places of interest.

properties.name: The Steamship Project Space
properties.description: With a sculpture garden, performance art in the attic and live music in the bowels of The Steamship, built in the heart of Docklands 1885, the resident artists show how the area has transformed and how they've transformed the former pub.

properties.name: The Steamship Project Space
properties.description: With a sculpture garden, performance art in the attic and live music in the bowels of The Steamship, built in the heart of Docklands 1885, the resident artists show how the area has transformed and how they've transformed the former pub.

properties.name: The Steamship Project Space
properties.description: With a sculpture garden, performance art in the attic and live music in the bowels of The Steamship, built in the heart of Docklands 1885, the resident artists show how the area has transformed and how they've transformed the former pub.

properties.name: Gareth Gardner Gallery
properties.description: Gareth Gardner Gallery is a small gallery space in Deptford, showing photography of architecture and the built environment. The fit-out was designed by architect Studio C102 and its industrial style was inspired by art gallery warehouses.

properties.name: Wellbeing Walk: South Kensington
properties.description: Our walking tour takes inspiration from the streets of South Kensington to explore practical ways to support wellbeing and find pools of calm in the midst of London's buzz and bustle.

properties.name: ShedX: Baking Ideas, Tolworth Station
properties.description: A meanwhile project developed by The Community Brain as a hub for activities exploring rewilding, access to local green space, and other initiatives including a new community farm. Shortlisted for the Open City Stewardship Awards 2021.

properties.name: ShedX: Baking Ideas, Tolworth Station
properties.description: A meanwhile project developed by The Community Brain as a hub for activities exploring rewilding, access to local green space, and other initiatives including a new community farm. Shortlisted for the Open City Stewardship Awards 2021.

properties.name: Scene change: Lost and hidden East West End theatres
properties.description: This walking tour will explore a variety of spaces and places, vanished sites and hidden venues, from priory remains to the site of former indoor tennis courts, and following the movement of the westward expansion of the capital.

properties.name: Montagu Evans 11th and 12th Floors
properties.description: Montagu Evans LLP Head office, situated on floors 11 & 12 within 70 St Mary Axe - nicknamed the Can Of Ham. Montagu Evans offices house up to 220 colleagues onsite who work within the property management business.
